description.narrative: The Voices of Youth in Sahel

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Cooperation policies take the needs of youth organisations into account through the regional dialogue gathering national authorities, the G5 Sahel, the European Union and its member States
1 G5 Sahel Integrated Youth Strategy, along with a plan of action, are adopted
Youth organizations have managed to be included in national decision-making processes
National dialogue frameworks, gathering both authorities and youth organisations representatives, allow the negotiation of consensus measures to prevent and manage social tensions involving youth

target.value: 5 agreements are negotiated at national level and pave the way for national debates in order to prevent or address social tensions.

actual.value: 2 agreements negotiated: the first youth policy in Chad’s history has been adopted, as well as a national strategy in Niger on youth entrepreneurship. Both processes involved youth representatives who directly engaged with their national authorities to contribute to the decision-making process. 2 policies remain under negotiation: Stratégie nationale de promotion de l’entreprenariat des Jeunes du Burkina Faso and Politique cadre de développement de la jeunesse du Mali.

title.narrative: Youth organizations have managed to be included in local decision-making processes
Dialogue between local authorities and youth organization is sustainable across the 25 regions of intervention

target.value: 5 local frameworks of dialogue per country of intervention, gathering both youth organisation representatives and authorities, are sustainable

actual.value: 75 local meetings facilitated (15 in each country), gathering youth representatives and selected elders to build their capacity to mediate tensions involving young people in their localities. This resulted in 1250 young people and 375 elders being trained in mediation. The 75 meetings also allowed youth representatives to engage with their local authorities to prepare formal local agreements to be signed between them and the authorities before the end of the project. Those meetings contributed to building sustainability of each local framework, which should be reached in 2021 at the end of the project that remains funded by the EU until then.

title.narrative: Youth organizations have been able to participate in decision-making processes at the local, national and regional levels
Political and socio‐economic decision‐making processes at local, national and regional levels include youth organizations

target.value:
1) 1 national and 5 local frameworks of dialogue per country of intervention, gathering both youth organisation representatives and authorities, support the authorities to ease the prevention of social tensions through youth inclusion in decision-making processes.
2) 1 regional framework of dialogue is at the G5 Sahel’s disposal to feed the follow-up process of the implementation of the integrated youth strategy.
